longBusinessSummary: Sapporo Holdings Limited engages in alcoholic beverages, foods and soft drinks, restaurants, and real estate businesses in Japan, North America, and internationally. It operates through three segments: Alcoholic Beverages, Food & Soft Drinks, and Real Estate. It produces and sells beer, low-malt beer, wine, western liquor, spirits, and other alcoholic beverages under the Black label, Yebisu, and Mugi to Hop brand names; and soft drinks that include fruit juices and coffee, lemon based favor products, soybeans and chilled products, bottled water, and food and soup products, as well as operates beer halls, cafes, and restaurants. The company also manages, leases, and operates office spaces, residential units, retail stores, restaurants, cultural facilities, and shopping and entertainment complex, as well as supplies energy. Further, it engages in the in-store merchandising/draft beer quality enhancement business; sale and marketing of beverages and foods; operation of vending machines and tea dispensers; manufacture and sale of ice cream, miso soups, and freeze-dried products; import, process, manufacture, and sale of spices, herbs and dehydrated vegetables; and provision of consigned freight forwarding, cargo handling, warehousing, packaging and distribution packaging, processing services, etc. As of March 31, 2020, it operated 189 restaurant outlets. The company sells its products primarily to retailers and wholesalers. Sapporo Holdings Limited was founded in 1876 and is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan.
